intro: Ilex macoucoua, commonly known as the Cuban holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. It is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Ilex macoucoua plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its native habitats.
